section.title: deps/cglm/include/cglm/struct/mat4.h File Reference

listitem.para: make given matrix identity. It is identical with below, but it is more easy to do that with this func especially for members e.g. glm_mat4_identity(aStruct->aMatrix);
CGLM_INLINE void glms_mat4_identity_array (mat4s *__restrict mat, size_t count)
make given matrix array's each element identity matrix
copy upper-left of mat4 to mat3
copy upper-left of mat4 to mat3 (transposed)
CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_mul (mat4s m1, mat4s m2)
multiply m1 and m2 to dest
CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_mulN (mat4s *__restrict matrices[], uint32_t len)
mupliply N mat4 matrices and store result in dest
CGLM_INLINE vec4s glms_mat4_mulv (mat4s m, vec4s v)
multiply mat4 with vec4 (column vector) and store in dest vector
convert mat4's rotation part to quaternion
CGLM_INLINE vec3s glms_mat4_mulv3 (mat4s m, vec3s v, float last)
tranpose mat4 and store result in same matrix
CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_scale_p (mat4s m, float s)
scale (multiply with scalar) matrix without simd optimization
CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_scale (mat4s m, float s)
inverse mat4 and store in dest
inverse mat4 and store in dest
CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_swap_col (mat4s mat, int col1, int col2)
CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_swap_row (mat4s mat, int row1, int row2)
CGLM_INLINE float glms_mat4_rmc (vec4s r, mat4s m, vec4s c)
helper for R (row vector) * M (matrix) * C (column vector)

section.title: glms_mat4_inv_fast()

para.para: inverse mat4 and store in dest

section.para: this func uses reciprocal approximation without extra corrections e.g Newton-Raphson. this should work faster than normal, to get more precise use glm_mat4_inv version.
NOTE: You will lose precision, glm_mat4_inv is more accurate
Definition at line 403 of file mat4.h.

section.title: glms_mat4_mul()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE mat4s glms_mat4_mul (mat4s m1, mat4s m2)

para.para: multiply m1 and m2 to dest

section.para: m1, m2 and dest matrices can be same matrix, it is possible to write this:

literallayout.computeroutput: mat4 m = GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY_INIT; glm_mat4_mul(m, m, m);

section.title: glms_mat4_rmc()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE float glms_mat4_rmc (vec4s r, mat4s m, vec4s c)

para.para: helper for R (row vector) * M (matrix) * C (column vector)

section.para: rmc stands for Row * Matrix * Column
the result is scalar because R * M = Matrix1x4 (row vector), then Matrix1x4 * Vec4 (column vector) = Matrix1x1 (Scalar)
